div1.head: Letter from Charles Sutherland to the Adjutant General, April 22, 1893
div1.opener:
All official communications to this Office should be addressed “To the Surgeon General, U. S. Army, Washington. D.C.”
Subject: Medical Supplies, etc.
N.
War Department,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, April 22, 1893.
To the
Adjutant General,
U. S. Army.
Sir: Cancelled
div1.p:
I have the honor to state that Captain Walter Reed,
Assistant Surgeon U. S. Army, in charge of the Medical Di-
rector's Office at St. Paul, Minnesota, telegraphs for extra
medical supplies to be sent to Fort Yates, North Dakota, where
it is alleged there is much sickness.

I have given authority to purchase these articles under
an emergency and to have them shipped by express.

I have to request that the Department Commander be di-
rected by telegraph to send Assistant Surgeon Reed at once to
Fort Yates to investigate the sanitary condition of the post
and make prompt report in regard to the sickness. During the
absence of Ass't. Surgeon Reed a local physician can be employed
under G. O. 75, of '91.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, C Sutherland Surgeon General,
U. S. Army.
